channel.title: How can I host my RSC server on my website?
channel.description:
Ok, so I downloaded easyRSC and related tools to get started making my own server. I took a look inside and checked out all the folders/files.
I do NOT want to host my server on my computer... I want to put it on my website.
If anyone could help me I'd be forever grateful :)

item.title: How can I host my RSC server on my website?
item.dc:creator: @samanthapk samanthapk
item.description:
@samanthapk wrote:

im sry im new to all this stuff lol i was just asking a simple Q and wanted a good answer but i wont be gettting a vps server for this til ive fixed all the bugs and other stuff i need in it ok just wanted to know so i can test it out u know

Read full topic

item.title: How can I host my RSC server on my website?
item.dc:creator: @Jessekinss Jessekinss
item.description:
@Jessekinss wrote:

[quote=“Grr Pker127, post:6, topic:296470”][quote author=gawdz666 link=topic=392466.msg2922042#msg2922042 date=1250812429]
host it on ur ips give ur ips out.

mmk then get ddos’d by queers and lose internets for 6 hours or so.

just follow shobs shit especially the ?? one.
[/quote]

Lol thats a good idea. I could just give out my no-ip… then they wouldnt ddos me would they?[/quote]

If it was that simple everyone would be doing it.

If you don’t have a modem, then you wouldn’t have to worry about your server being down for too long (your IP would change once disconnected). If you do have a modem, don’t bother, you’d have to change your IP manually.
Fixing it to work server-side (adding the no-ip) would take a little work. I don’t think you can have URL’s in world.xml, just an IP.

Read full topic
